results.firPara: Gianni De Biasi must be the only Italian who has been offered Albanian citizenship by the countrys president. Such a gesture speaks volumes for his achievement, with Albania gripped by Euro 2016 fever caused by reaching their first major championship​.
results.secPara: De Biasis and Albanias story is a remarkable one. The 59-year-old took charge four and a half years ago and the Eagles progress has been drastic. They finished second bottom of their qualification group for Euro 2012 having lost to Luxembourg but defied Denmark and Serbia to end the recent campaign as automatic qualifiers for the 2016 tournament behind Portugal.
results.webTitle: Albania coach Gianni De Biasi: ‘I don’t want us to be tourists. Fairytales can happen’

results.firPara: Who will win the final? Who will be the leading scorer? How far will England go and who will be the player to watch? Our team tackle these and other questions
results.secPara: Dominic Fifield France to edge out a Cristiano Ronaldo-inspired Portugal.
results.webTitle: Euro 2016: Guardian writers’ predictions for the tournament in France

results.firPara: Todays fluff is bright and early
results.secPara: Todays fluff is bright and early
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: John Stones to pick Manchester City over Barcelona?

results.firPara: • Super Victor was designed by Euro 2016 organisers as a boy with a cape
results.secPara: In a build-up marked by tension over weightier matters, Euro 2016 organisers face embarrassment of a different kind after it emerged their mascot shares its name with a popular sex toy.
results.webTitle: Euro 2016: Uefa red-faced as mascot shares name with sex toy

results.firPara: Thats all for now. Thanks as always for following with us and be sure to check out the full match report here.
results.secPara: And there it is! Mexico (and Venezuela) are through to the quarter-finals. Eleven straight wins for El Tri, who are unbeaten in their last 21. Theyve yet to lose under Osorio nine matches, nine wins, 19 goals scored and only one conceded.
results.webTitle: Mexico 2-0 Jamaica: Copa América – as it happened

results.firPara: Roy Hodgsons determination to exploit an ageing Russia defence has thrust Raheem Sterling into serious contention to start Englands opening Group B fixture in Marseille.
results.secPara: The manager is considering an attack-minded selection laced with pace for Saturdays match at Stade Vélodrome as he contemplates how to incorporate Harry Kane, Wayne Rooney, Dele Alli, Adam Lallana and Sterling in his lineup. Jamie Vardys hopes of playing a part have not been entirely dashed, though it remains to be seen whether the Leicester City forward, the subject of a £20m bid from Arsenal, begins the game. He is more likely to start on the bench.
results.webTitle: Raheem Sterling could start for England in Euro 2016 opener with Russia

results.firPara: Liverpool have opened talks with Emre Can over a long-term contract that reflects his impressive development at Anfield.
results.secPara: The 22-year-old, part of Germanys squad at the European Championship, was a key figure for Jürgen Klopp last season as Liverpool progressed to the Europa League final.
results.webTitle: Liverpool open talks with Emre Can over long-term contract

results.firPara: Aaron Ramsey said Leicesters Citys Premier League title success has encouraged him to believe that anything can happen at Euro 2016, and the Arsenal midfielder revealed his hopes of springing a surprise in France have been boosted further by Arsène Wengers assertion that Wales will be a dangerous team.
results.secPara: Ramsey explained how the Arsenal manager told him before he left for France that Wales have the potential to be awkward opponents in a tournament where Chris Coleman and his players want to prove a point and progress to the knockout stage at the very least.
results.webTitle: Aaron Ramsey says Leicester and Wenger encourage Wales at Euro 2016

results.firPara: Englands footballers are facing the prospect of a sleepless night before their opening Euro 2016 game against Russia on Saturday after being given a hotel close to Marseilles fan zone – and a beach party that will go on until the early hours involving up to 80,000 people.
results.secPara: Roy Hodgson and his players are preparing for a restless night after Uefa designated them the four-star Golden Tulip Villa Massalia close to the site at Plage du Prado where Frances opening game against Romania will be shown on two giant screens, followed by a live concert by Cerrone, a record producer billed as the master of French disco.
results.webTitle: England find Marseille ready to party – right outside Euro 2016 hotel

results.firPara: Hugo Lloris confesses that adrenaline levels started to rise soon after the French squad left Clairefontaine and headed for their hotel near Stade de France
results.secPara: Frances captain, Hugo Lloris, has confessed his sides opening match against Romania will signal the start of the biggest month of their lives, while seeking to downplay their status as favourites.
results.webTitle: Didier Deschamps lulls France into frame of mind to give their best
